<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<installer-gui-script minSpecVersion="2">
    <title>SPLICE - AI Video Editor</title>
    <organization>com.splice</organization>
    <domains enable_localSystem="true" enable_currentUserHome="false"/>
    
    <!-- Minimum OS version -->
    <os-version min="10.14"/>
    
    <!-- Require admin for system-wide installation -->
    <options require-scripts="true" customize="never" rootVolumeOnly="true" hostArchitectures="x86_64,arm64"/>
    
    <!-- Background image and styling -->
    <background file="background.png" alignment="bottomleft" scaling="none"/>
    <background-darkAqua file="background-dark.png" alignment="bottomleft" scaling="none"/>
    
    <!-- Welcome screen -->
    <welcome file="welcome.html" mime-type="text/html"/>
    
    <!-- License agreement -->
    <license file="license.html" mime-type="text/html"/>
    
    <!-- Readme/Introduction -->
    <readme file="readme.html" mime-type="text/html"/>
    
    <!-- Conclusion screen -->
    <conclusion file="conclusion.html" mime-type="text/html"/>
    
    <!-- Installation check script -->
    <installation-check script="installCheck()"/>
    <script>
    function installCheck() {
        // Check if Adobe Premiere Pro is running
        if (system.run('/bin/bash', '-c', 'pgrep -x "Adobe Premiere Pro"') == 0) {
            my.result.title = 'Adobe Premiere Pro is Running';
            my.result.message = 'Please close Adobe Premiere Pro before installing SPLICE.';
            my.result.type = 'Fatal';
            return false;
        }
        return true;
    }
    </script>
    
    <!-- Volume check script -->
    <volume-check script="volumeCheck()"/>
    <script>
    function volumeCheck() {
        // Require at least 50MB free space
        if (my.target.availableKilobytes < 51200) {
            my.result.title = 'Insufficient Disk Space';
            my.result.message = 'SPLICE requires at least 50MB of free disk space.';
            my.result.type = 'Fatal';
            return false;
        }
        return true;
    }
    </script>
    
    <!-- Choices outline - defines what appears in installer -->
    <choices-outline>
        <line choice="splice-cep"/>
        <line choice="splice-uxp"/>
    </choices-outline>
    
    <!-- CEP Extension choice (always installed) -->
    <choice id="splice-cep" 
            title="SPLICE CEP Extension" 
            description="Required extension for Premiere Pro 14.0 - 24.x"
            visible="false"
            enabled="true"
            selected="true">
        <pkg-ref id="com.splice.panel.cep"/>
    </choice>
    
    <!-- UXP Plugin choice (always installed) -->
    <choice id="splice-uxp" 
            title="SPLICE UXP Plugin" 
            description="Enhanced plugin for Premiere Pro 25.0+"
            visible="false"
            enabled="true"
            selected="true">
        <pkg-ref id="com.splice.panel.uxp"/>
    </choice>
    
    <!-- Package references -->
    <pkg-ref id="com.splice.panel.cep"
             version="{{VERSION}}"
             installKBytes="10240"
             auth="Root"
             onConclusion="None">
        #splice-cep.pkg
    </pkg-ref>
    
    <pkg-ref id="com.splice.panel.uxp"
             version="{{VERSION}}"
             installKBytes="5120"
             auth="Root"
             onConclusion="None">
        #splice-uxp.pkg
    </pkg-ref>
    
</installer-gui-script>

1→
     2→#!/bin/bash
     3→# =============================================================================
     4→# SPLICE PKG Signing and Notarization Script
     5→# =============================================================================
     6→# This script signs a macOS PKG installer with Developer ID Installer certificate
     7→# and submits it to Apple's notary service for notarization.
     8→#
     9→# Prerequisites:
    10→#   - Developer ID Installer certificate installed in Keychain
    11→#   - Apple ID with App-Specific Password for notarization
    12→#   - xcrun notarytool (macOS 12+) or altool (legacy)
    13→#
    14→# Usage:
    15→#   ./sign-and-notarize.sh [options] <unsigned-pkg>
    16→#
    17→# Options:
    18→#   --identity    Certificate identity (default: auto-detect)
    19→#   --apple-id    Apple ID email for notarization
    20→#   --team-id     Apple Developer Team ID
    21→#   --password    App-specific password (or @keychain:name)
    22→#   --no-notarize Skip notarization (signing only)
    23→#   --output      Output path for signed PKG
    24→#   --help        Show this help message
    25→#
    26→# Environment Variables (alternative to options):
    27→#   SIGNING_IDENTITY  - Certificate identity
    28→#   APPLE_ID          - Apple ID email
    29→#   TEAM_ID           - Apple Developer Team ID  
    30→#   APP_PASSWORD      - App-specific password
    31→#
    32→# Example:
    33→#   ./sign-and-notarize.sh \
    34→#     --identity "Developer ID Installer: Your Company (TEAM_ID)" \
    35→#     --apple-id "your@email.com" \
    36→#     --team-id "TEAM_ID" \
    37→#     --password "@keychain:AC_PASSWORD" \
    38→#     dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg
    39→# =============================================================================
    40→
    41→set -e  # Exit on error
    42→
    43→# Colors for output
    44→RED='\033[0;31m'
    45→GREEN='\033[0;32m'
    46→YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
    47→BLUE='\033[0;34m'
    48→NC='\033[0m' # No Color
    49→
    50→# Script directory
    51→SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
    52→PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"
    53→
    54→# Default values from environment
    55→SIGNING_IDENTITY="${SIGNING_IDENTITY:-}"
    56→APPLE_ID="${APPLE_ID:-}"
    57→TEAM_ID="${TEAM_ID:-}"
    58→APP_PASSWORD="${APP_PASSWORD:-}"
    59→NOTARIZE=true
    60→INPUT_PKG=""
    61→OUTPUT_PKG=""
    62→
    63→# Logging functions
    64→log_info() {
    65→    echo -e "${BLUE}[INFO]${NC} $1"
    66→}
    67→
    68→log_success() {
    69→    echo -e "${GREEN}[SUCCESS]${NC} $1"
    70→}
    71→
    72→log_warning() {
    73→    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARNING]${NC} $1"
    74→}
    75→
    76→log_error() {
    77→    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
    78→}
    79→
    80→# Show help
    81→show_help() {
    82→    head -50 "$0" | grep "^#" | sed 's/^# //' | sed 's/^#//'
    83→    exit 0
    84→}
    85→
    86→# Parse command line arguments
    87→parse_args() {
    88→    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
    89→        case $1 in
    90→            --identity)
    91→                SIGNING_IDENTITY="$2"
    92→                shift 2
    93→                ;;
    94→            --apple-id)
    95→                APPLE_ID="$2"
    96→                shift 2
    97→                ;;
    98→            --team-id)
    99→                TEAM_ID="$2"
   100→                shift 2
   101→                ;;
   102→            --password)
   103→                APP_PASSWORD="$2"
   104→                shift 2
   105→                ;;
   106→            --no-notarize)
   107→                NOTARIZE=false
   108→                shift
   109→                ;;
   110→            --output)
   111→                OUTPUT_PKG="$2"
   112→                shift 2
   113→                ;;
   114→            --help|-h)
   115→                show_help
   116→                ;;
   117→            -*)
   118→                log_error "Unknown option: $1"
   119→                exit 1
   120→                ;;
   121→            *)
   122→                INPUT_PKG="$1"
   123→                shift
   124→                ;;
   125→        esac
   126→    done
   127→}
   128→
   129→# Find Developer ID Installer certificate
   130→find_signing_identity() {
   131→    if [[ -n "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" ]]; then
   132→        log_info "Using specified signing identity: $SIGNING_IDENTITY"
   133→        return
   134→    fi
   135→    
   136→    log_info "Searching for Developer ID Installer certificate..."
   137→    
   138→    # Search for Developer ID Installer certificates
   139→    IDENTITIES=$(security find-identity -v -p basic 2>/dev/null | grep "Developer ID Installer" || true)
   140→    
   141→    if [[ -z "$IDENTITIES" ]]; then
   142→        log_error "No 'Developer ID Installer' certificate found in Keychain!"
   143→        echo ""
   144→        echo "To create a Developer ID Installer certificate:"
   145→        echo "1. Open Keychain Access"
   146→        echo "2. Go to: Keychain Access → Certificate Assistant → Request a Certificate From a Certificate Authority"
   147→        echo "3. Save the CSR file to disk"
   148→        echo "4. Go to: https://developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates/list"
   149→        echo "5. Click '+' to create a new certificate"
   150→        echo "6. Select 'Developer ID Installer' (NOT Developer ID Application)"
   151→        echo "7. Upload your CSR file"
   152→        echo "8. Download and double-click to install the certificate"
   153→        echo ""
   154→        echo "See: installer/macos/create-app-specific-password.md for detailed instructions"
   155→        exit 1
   156→    fi
   157→    
   158→    # Extract the first certificate
   159→    SIGNING_IDENTITY=$(echo "$IDENTITIES" | head -1 | sed 's/.*"\(.*\)"/\1/')
   160→    log_success "Found signing identity: $SIGNING_IDENTITY"
   161→}
   162→
   163→# Verify input PKG exists
   164→verify_input() {
   165→    if [[ -z "$INPUT_PKG" ]]; then
   166→        log_error "No input PKG file specified!"
   167→        echo "Usage: $0 [options] <unsigned-pkg>"
   168→        exit 1
   169→    fi
   170→    
   171→    if [[ ! -f "$INPUT_PKG" ]]; then
   172→        log_error "Input PKG file not found: $INPUT_PKG"
   173→        exit 1
   174→    fi
   175→    
   176→    log_info "Input PKG: $INPUT_PKG"
   177→    
   178→    # Set output path if not specified
   179→    if [[ -z "$OUTPUT_PKG" ]]; then
   180→        BASENAME=$(basename "$INPUT_PKG" .pkg)
   181→        DIRNAME=$(dirname "$INPUT_PKG")
   182→        OUTPUT_PKG="${DIRNAME}/${BASENAME}-signed.pkg"
   183→    fi
   184→    
   185→    log_info "Output PKG: $OUTPUT_PKG"
   186→}
   187→
   188→# Sign the PKG
   189→sign_pkg() {
   190→    log_info "Signing PKG with productsign..."
   191→    
   192→    # Remove existing signed PKG if it exists
   193→    if [[ -f "$OUTPUT_PKG" ]]; then
   194→        rm "$OUTPUT_PKG"
   195→    fi
   196→    
   197→    # Sign with productsign
   198→    productsign --sign "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" "$INPUT_PKG" "$OUTPUT_PKG"
   199→    
   200→    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
   201→        log_success "PKG signed successfully!"
   202→    else
   203→        log_error "Failed to sign PKG"
   204→        exit 1
   205→    fi
   206→    
   207→    # Verify signature
   208→    log_info "Verifying signature..."
   209→    pkgutil --check-signature "$OUTPUT_PKG"
   210→    
   211→    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
   212→        log_success "Signature verified!"
   213→    else
   214→        log_error "Signature verification failed!"
   215→        exit 1
   216→    fi
   217→}
   218→
   219→# Notarize the PKG
   220→notarize_pkg() {
   221→    if [[ "$NOTARIZE" != "true" ]]; then
   222→        log_warning "Skipping notarization (--no-notarize specified)"
   223→        return
   224→    fi
   225→    
   226→    # Check required credentials
   227→    if [[ -z "$APPLE_ID" ]]; then
   228→        log_error "Apple ID not specified! Use --apple-id or set APPLE_ID environment variable"
   229→        exit 1
   230→    fi
   231→    
   232→    if [[ -z "$TEAM_ID" ]]; then
   233→        log_error "Team ID not specified! Use --team-id or set TEAM_ID environment variable"
   234→        exit 1
   235→    fi
   236→    
   237→    if [[ -z "$APP_PASSWORD" ]]; then
   238→        log_error "App-specific password not specified! Use --password or set APP_PASSWORD environment variable"
   239→        echo ""
   240→        echo "See: installer/macos/create-app-specific-password.md for instructions"
   241→        exit 1
   242→    fi
   243→    
   244→    log_info "Submitting to Apple notary service..."
   245→    log_info "This may take several minutes..."
   246→    
   247→    # Submit for notarization using notarytool (macOS 12+)
   248→    if xcrun notarytool --version &>/dev/null; then
   249→        # Use notarytool (preferred, macOS 12+)
   250→        SUBMISSION_OUTPUT=$(xcrun notarytool submit "$OUTPUT_PKG" \
   251→            --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
   252→            --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
   253→            --password "$APP_PASSWORD" \
   254→            --wait 2>&1)
   255→        
   256→        echo "$SUBMISSION_OUTPUT"
   257→        
   258→        # Check if successful
   259→        if echo "$SUBMISSION_OUTPUT" | grep -q "status: Accepted"; then
   260→            log_success "Notarization successful!"
   261→        else
   262→            log_error "Notarization failed!"
   263→            
   264→            # Try to get the log
   265→            SUBMISSION_ID=$(echo "$SUBMISSION_OUTPUT" | grep "id:" | head -1 | awk '{print $2}')
   266→            if [[ -n "$SUBMISSION_ID" ]]; then
   267→                log_info "Fetching notarization log..."
   268→                xcrun notarytool log "$SUBMISSION_ID" \
   269→                    --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
   270→                    --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
   271→                    --password "$APP_PASSWORD"
   272→            fi
   273→            exit 1
   274→        fi
   275→    else
   276→        # Fall back to altool (legacy)
   277→        log_warning "notarytool not found, using altool (legacy)..."
   278→        
   279→        xcrun altool --notarize-app \
   280→            --primary-bundle-id "com.splice.installer" \
   281→            --username "$APPLE_ID" \
   282→            --password "$APP_PASSWORD" \
   283→            --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
   284→            --file "$OUTPUT_PKG"
   285→        
   286→        log_warning "Notarization submitted. Check status manually with:"
   287→        echo "  xcrun altool --notarization-history 0 -u $APPLE_ID -p <password>"
   288→    fi
   289→}
   290→
   291→# Staple the notarization ticket
   292→staple_pkg() {
   293→    if [[ "$NOTARIZE" != "true" ]]; then
   294→        return
   295→    fi
   296→    
   297→    log_info "Stapling notarization ticket to PKG..."
   298→    
   299→    xcrun stapler staple "$OUTPUT_PKG"
   300→    
   301→    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
   302→        log_success "Notarization ticket stapled successfully!"
   303→    else
   304→        log_error "Failed to staple notarization ticket"
   305→        exit 1
   306→    fi
   307→}
   308→
   309→# Final verification
   310→final_verification() {
   311→    log_info "Performing final verification..."
   312→    
   313→    echo ""
   314→    echo "=========================================="
   315→    echo "PKG Signature Information:"
   316→    echo "=========================================="
   317→    pkgutil --check-signature "$OUTPUT_PKG"
   318→    
   319→    echo ""
   320→    echo "=========================================="
   321→    echo "Gatekeeper Assessment:"
   322→    echo "=========================================="
   323→    spctl --assess -vv --type install "$OUTPUT_PKG" 2>&1 || true
   324→    
   325→    echo ""
   326→    log_success "All done!"
   327→    echo ""
   328→    echo "Signed PKG: $OUTPUT_PKG"
   329→    echo ""
   330→    echo "You can distribute this PKG. Users on macOS 10.15+ should be able to"
   331→    echo "install it without any Gatekeeper warnings."
   332→}
   333→
   334→# Main execution
   335→main() {
   336→    echo ""
   337→    echo "============================================="
   338→    echo "  SPLICE PKG Signing and Notarization Tool  "
   339→    echo "============================================="
   340→    echo ""
   341→    
   342→    parse_args "$@"
   343→    verify_input
   344→    find_signing_identity
   345→    sign_pkg
   346→    notarize_pkg
   347→    staple_pkg
   348→    final_verification
   349→}
   350→
   351→# Run main
   352→main "$@"
   353→

#!/bin/bash
# =============================================================================
# SPLICE PKG Signing and Notarization Script
# =============================================================================
# This script signs a macOS PKG installer with Developer ID Installer certificate
# and submits it to Apple's notary service for notarization.
#
# Prerequisites:
#   - Developer ID Installer certificate installed in Keychain
#   - Apple ID with App-Specific Password for notarization
#   - xcrun notarytool (macOS 12+) or altool (legacy)
#
# Usage:
#   ./sign-and-notarize.sh [options] <unsigned-pkg>
#
# Options:
#   --identity    Certificate identity (default: auto-detect)
#   --apple-id    Apple ID email for notarization
#   --team-id     Apple Developer Team ID
#   --password    App-specific password (or @keychain:name)
#   --no-notarize Skip notarization (signing only)
#   --output      Output path for signed PKG
#   --help        Show this help message
#
# Environment Variables (alternative to options):
#   SIGNING_IDENTITY  - Certificate identity
#   APPLE_ID          - Apple ID email
#   TEAM_ID           - Apple Developer Team ID  
#   APP_PASSWORD      - App-specific password
#
# Example:
#   ./sign-and-notarize.sh \
#     --identity "Developer ID Installer: Your Company (TEAM_ID)" \
#     --apple-id "your@email.com" \
#     --team-id "TEAM_ID" \
#     --password "@keychain:AC_PASSWORD" \
#     dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg
# =============================================================================

set -e  # Exit on error

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"

# Default values from environment
SIGNING_IDENTITY="${SIGNING_IDENTITY:-}"
APPLE_ID="${APPLE_ID:-}"
TEAM_ID="${TEAM_ID:-}"
APP_PASSWORD="${APP_PASSWORD:-}"
NOTARIZE=true
INPUT_PKG=""
OUTPUT_PKG=""

# Logging functions
log_info() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[INFO]${NC} $1"
}

log_success() {
    echo -e "${GREEN}[SUCCESS]${NC} $1"
}

log_warning() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARNING]${NC} $1"
}

log_error() {
    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
}

# Show help
show_help() {
    head -50 "$0" | grep "^#" | sed 's/^# //' | sed 's/^#//'
    exit 0
}

# Parse command line arguments
parse_args() {
    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
        case $1 in
            --identity)
                SIGNING_IDENTITY="$2"
                shift 2
                ;;
            --apple-id)
                APPLE_ID="$2"
                shift 2
                ;;
            --team-id)
                TEAM_ID="$2"
                shift 2
                ;;
            --password)
                APP_PASSWORD="$2"
                shift 2
                ;;
            --no-notarize)
                NOTARIZE=false
                shift
                ;;
            --output)
                OUTPUT_PKG="$2"
                shift 2
                ;;
            --help|-h)
                show_help
                ;;
            -*)
                log_error "Unknown option: $1"
                exit 1
                ;;
            *)
                INPUT_PKG="$1"
                shift
                ;;
        esac
    done
}

# Find Developer ID Installer certificate
find_signing_identity() {
    if [[ -n "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" ]]; then
        log_info "Using specified signing identity: $SIGNING_IDENTITY"
        return
    fi
    
    log_info "Searching for Developer ID Installer certificate..."
    
    # Search for Developer ID Installer certificates
    IDENTITIES=$(security find-identity -v -p basic 2>/dev/null | grep "Developer ID Installer" || true)
    
    if [[ -z "$IDENTITIES" ]]; then
        log_error "No 'Developer ID Installer' certificate found in Keychain!"
        echo ""
        echo "To create a Developer ID Installer certificate:"
        echo "1. Open Keychain Access"
        echo "2. Go to: Keychain Access → Certificate Assistant → Request a Certificate From a Certificate Authority"
        echo "3. Save the CSR file to disk"
        echo "4. Go to: https://developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates/list"
        echo "5. Click '+' to create a new certificate"
        echo "6. Select 'Developer ID Installer' (NOT Developer ID Application)"
        echo "7. Upload your CSR file"
        echo "8. Download and double-click to install the certificate"
        echo ""
        echo "See: installer/macos/create-app-specific-password.md for detailed instructions"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Extract the first certificate
    SIGNING_IDENTITY=$(echo "$IDENTITIES" | head -1 | sed 's/.*"\(.*\)"/\1/')
    log_success "Found signing identity: $SIGNING_IDENTITY"
}

# Verify input PKG exists
verify_input() {
    if [[ -z "$INPUT_PKG" ]]; then
        log_error "No input PKG file specified!"
        echo "Usage: $0 [options] <unsigned-pkg>"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [[ ! -f "$INPUT_PKG" ]]; then
        log_error "Input PKG file not found: $INPUT_PKG"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    log_info "Input PKG: $INPUT_PKG"
    
    # Set output path if not specified
    if [[ -z "$OUTPUT_PKG" ]]; then
        BASENAME=$(basename "$INPUT_PKG" .pkg)
        DIRNAME=$(dirname "$INPUT_PKG")
        OUTPUT_PKG="${DIRNAME}/${BASENAME}-signed.pkg"
    fi
    
    log_info "Output PKG: $OUTPUT_PKG"
}

# Sign the PKG
sign_pkg() {
    log_info "Signing PKG with productsign..."
    
    # Remove existing signed PKG if it exists
    if [[ -f "$OUTPUT_PKG" ]]; then
        rm "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    fi
    
    # Sign with productsign
    productsign --sign "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" "$INPUT_PKG" "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    
    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
        log_success "PKG signed successfully!"
    else
        log_error "Failed to sign PKG"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Verify signature
    log_info "Verifying signature..."
    pkgutil --check-signature "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    
    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
        log_success "Signature verified!"
    else
        log_error "Signature verification failed!"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Notarize the PKG
notarize_pkg() {
    if [[ "$NOTARIZE" != "true" ]]; then
        log_warning "Skipping notarization (--no-notarize specified)"
        return
    fi
    
    # Check required credentials
    if [[ -z "$APPLE_ID" ]]; then
        log_error "Apple ID not specified! Use --apple-id or set APPLE_ID environment variable"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [[ -z "$TEAM_ID" ]]; then
        log_error "Team ID not specified! Use --team-id or set TEAM_ID environment variable"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [[ -z "$APP_PASSWORD" ]]; then
        log_error "App-specific password not specified! Use --password or set APP_PASSWORD environment variable"
        echo ""
        echo "See: installer/macos/create-app-specific-password.md for instructions"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    log_info "Submitting to Apple notary service..."
    log_info "This may take several minutes..."
    
    # Submit for notarization using notarytool (macOS 12+)
    if xcrun notarytool --version &>/dev/null; then
        # Use notarytool (preferred, macOS 12+)
        SUBMISSION_OUTPUT=$(xcrun notarytool submit "$OUTPUT_PKG" \
            --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
            --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
            --password "$APP_PASSWORD" \
            --wait 2>&1)
        
        echo "$SUBMISSION_OUTPUT"
        
        # Check if successful
        if echo "$SUBMISSION_OUTPUT" | grep -q "status: Accepted"; then
            log_success "Notarization successful!"
        else
            log_error "Notarization failed!"
            
            # Try to get the log
            SUBMISSION_ID=$(echo "$SUBMISSION_OUTPUT" | grep "id:" | head -1 | awk '{print $2}')
            if [[ -n "$SUBMISSION_ID" ]]; then
                log_info "Fetching notarization log..."
                xcrun notarytool log "$SUBMISSION_ID" \
                    --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
                    --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
                    --password "$APP_PASSWORD"
            fi
            exit 1
        fi
    else
        # Fall back to altool (legacy)
        log_warning "notarytool not found, using altool (legacy)..."
        
        xcrun altool --notarize-app \
            --primary-bundle-id "com.splice.installer" \
            --username "$APPLE_ID" \
            --password "$APP_PASSWORD" \
            --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
            --file "$OUTPUT_PKG"
        
        log_warning "Notarization submitted. Check status manually with:"
        echo "  xcrun altool --notarization-history 0 -u $APPLE_ID -p <password>"
    fi
}

# Staple the notarization ticket
staple_pkg() {
    if [[ "$NOTARIZE" != "true" ]]; then
        return
    fi
    
    log_info "Stapling notarization ticket to PKG..."
    
    xcrun stapler staple "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    
    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
        log_success "Notarization ticket stapled successfully!"
    else
        log_error "Failed to staple notarization ticket"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Final verification
final_verification() {
    log_info "Performing final verification..."
    
    echo ""
    echo "=========================================="
    echo "PKG Signature Information:"
    echo "=========================================="
    pkgutil --check-signature "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    
    echo ""
    echo "=========================================="
    echo "Gatekeeper Assessment:"
    echo "=========================================="
    spctl --assess -vv --type install "$OUTPUT_PKG" 2>&1 || true
    
    echo ""
    log_success "All done!"
    echo ""
    echo "Signed PKG: $OUTPUT_PKG"
    echo ""
    echo "You can distribute this PKG. Users on macOS 10.15+ should be able to"
    echo "install it without any Gatekeeper warnings."
}

# Main execution
main() {
    echo ""
    echo "============================================="
    echo "  SPLICE PKG Signing and Notarization Tool  "
    echo "============================================="
    echo ""
    
    parse_args "$@"
    verify_input
    find_signing_identity
    sign_pkg
    notarize_pkg
    staple_pkg
    final_verification
}

# Run main
main "$@"

1→#!/bin/bash
     2→#
     3→# SPLICE Plugin - macOS PKG Installer Build Script
     4→# Builds a signed .pkg installer using pkgbuild and productbuild
     5→#
     6→
     7→set -e
     8→
     9→# Script directory
    10→SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
    11→PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"
    12→INSTALLER_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR"
    13→
    14→# Source directories
    15→CEP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-cep"
    16→UXP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-plugin"
    17→SHARED_ASSETS="$SCRIPT_DIR/../shared/assets"
    18→
    19→# Build directories
    20→BUILD_DIR="$INSTALLER_DIR/build"
    21→STAGING_DIR="$BUILD_DIR/staging"
    22→OUTPUT_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/dist"
    23→
    24→# Version info
    25→VERSION_FILE="$SCRIPT_DIR/../shared/version.json"
    26→if [ -f "$VERSION_FILE" ]; then
    27→    VERSION=$(grep -o '"version"[[:space:]]*:[[:space:]]*"[^"]*"' "$VERSION_FILE" | cut -d'"' -f4)
    28→else
    29→    VERSION="6.0.3"
    30→fi
    31→
    32→# Package identifiers
    33→BUNDLE_ID="com.splice.panel"
    34→CEP_PKG_ID="${BUNDLE_ID}.cep"
    35→UXP_PKG_ID="${BUNDLE_ID}.uxp"
    36→
    37→# Signing identity (set via environment or parameter)
    38→SIGNING_IDENTITY="${SIGNING_IDENTITY:-}"
    39→NOTARIZE="${NOTARIZE:-false}"
    40→APPLE_ID="${APPLE_ID:-}"
    41→TEAM_ID="${TEAM_ID:-}"
    42→APP_PASSWORD="${APP_PASSWORD:-}"
    43→
    44→# Output filenames
    45→PKG_NAME="SPLICE-Installer-${VERSION}.pkg"
    46→UNSIGNED_PKG_NAME="SPLICE-Installer-${VERSION}-unsigned.pkg"
    47→
    48→# Colors for output
    49→RED='\033[0;31m'
    50→GREEN='\033[0;32m'
    51→YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
    52→NC='\033[0m' # No Color
    53→
    54→log_info() {
    55→    echo -e "${GREEN}[INFO]${NC} $1"
    56→}
    57→
    58→log_warn() {
    59→    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $1"
    60→}
    61→
    62→log_error() {
    63→    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
    64→}
    65→
    66→# Show usage
    67→usage() {
    68→    echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
    69→    echo ""
    70→    echo "Options:"
    71→    echo "  --sign IDENTITY     Sign package with Developer ID Installer certificate"
    72→    echo "  --notarize          Notarize the signed package (requires --sign)"

#!/bin/bash
#
# SPLICE Plugin - macOS PKG Installer Build Script
# Builds a signed .pkg installer using pkgbuild and productbuild
#

set -e

# Script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"
INSTALLER_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR"

# Source directories
CEP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-cep"
UXP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-plugin"
SHARED_ASSETS="$SCRIPT_DIR/../shared/assets"

# Build directories
BUILD_DIR="$INSTALLER_DIR/build"
STAGING_DIR="$BUILD_DIR/staging"
OUTPUT_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/dist"

# Version info
VERSION_FILE="$SCRIPT_DIR/../shared/version.json"
if [ -f "$VERSION_FILE" ]; then
    VERSION=$(grep -o '"version"[[:space:]]*:[[:space:]]*"[^"]*"' "$VERSION_FILE" | cut -d'"' -f4)
else
    VERSION="6.0.3"
fi

# Package identifiers
BUNDLE_ID="com.splice.panel"
CEP_PKG_ID="${BUNDLE_ID}.cep"
UXP_PKG_ID="${BUNDLE_ID}.uxp"

# Signing identity (set via environment or parameter)
SIGNING_IDENTITY="${SIGNING_IDENTITY:-}"
NOTARIZE="${NOTARIZE:-false}"
APPLE_ID="${APPLE_ID:-}"
TEAM_ID="${TEAM_ID:-}"
APP_PASSWORD="${APP_PASSWORD:-}"

# Output filenames
PKG_NAME="SPLICE-Installer-${VERSION}.pkg"
UNSIGNED_PKG_NAME="SPLICE-Installer-${VERSION}-unsigned.pkg"

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

log_info() {
    echo -e "${GREEN}[INFO]${NC} $1"
}

log_warn() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $1"
}

log_error() {
    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
}

# Show usage
usage() {
    echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
    echo ""
    echo "Options:"
    echo "  --sign IDENTITY     Sign package with Developer ID Installer certificate"
    echo "  --notarize          Notarize the signed package (requires --sign)"
    echo "  --apple-id EMAIL    Apple ID for notarization"
    echo "  --team-id ID        Team ID for notarization"
    echo "  --password PWD      App-specific password for notarization"
    echo "  --help              Show this help message"
    echo ""
    echo "Environment variables:"
    echo "  SIGNING_IDENTITY    Developer ID Installer certificate name"
    echo "  NOTARIZE            Set to 'true' to notarize"

#!/bin/bash
#
# SPLICE CEP Panel - ZXP Package Builder
# Creates a .zxp package from CEP panel source
#
# ZXP is Adobe's signed package format for CEP extensions
#
# Usage:
#   ./build-zxp.sh              # Create unsigned ZXP
#   ./build-zxp.sh --sign       # Create signed ZXP with ZXPSignCmd
#   ./build-zxp.sh --jsxbin     # Compile JSX to JSXBin
#   ./build-zxp.sh --sign --jsxbin  # Both signing and compilation
#

set -e

# Script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"
INSTALLER_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Source and output paths
CEP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-cep"
OUTPUT_DIR="$INSTALLER_DIR/shared"
BUILD_TEMP="$INSTALLER_DIR/build/zxp-temp"

# Version info
VERSION_FILE="$INSTALLER_DIR/shared/version.json"
if [ -f "$VERSION_FILE" ]; then
    VERSION=$(grep -o '"version"[[:space:]]*:[[:space:]]*"[^"]*"' "$VERSION_FILE" | cut -d'"' -f4)
else
    VERSION="6.0.3"
fi

# Output filename
ZXP_OUTPUT="$OUTPUT_DIR/splice-cep.zxp"

# Parse command line arguments
SIGN_ZXP=false
COMPILE_JSXBIN=false

while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
    case $1 in
        --sign)
            SIGN_ZXP=true
            shift
            ;;
        --jsxbin)
            COMPILE_JSXBIN=true
            shift
            ;;
        --help|-h)
            echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
            echo ""
            echo "Options:"
            echo "  --sign      Sign ZXP with ZXPSignCmd (requires ZXPSignCmd installed)"
            echo "  --jsxbin    Compile JSX to JSXBin format for IP protection"
            echo "  --help      Show this help message"
            echo ""
            exit 0
            ;;
        *)
            echo "Unknown option: $1"
            echo "Use --help for usage information"
            exit 1
            ;;
    esac
done

# Colors
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
NC='\033[0m'

log_info() {
    echo -e "${GREEN}[INFO]${NC} $1"
}

log_warn() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $1"
}

log_error() {
    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
}

# Check requirements
check_requirements() {
    if [ ! -d "$CEP_SOURCE" ]; then
        log_error "CEP panel source not found: $CEP_SOURCE"
        exit 1
    fi

    if [ ! -f "$CEP_SOURCE/CSXS/manifest.xml" ]; then
        log_error "CEP manifest.xml not found"
        exit 1
    fi

#!/bin/bash
set -e

PROJECT_ROOT="/Users/imorgado/SPLICE"
cd "$PROJECT_ROOT"

echo "==================================="
echo "SPLICE Installer Rebuild & Verify"
echo "==================================="

# Get source file size
SOURCE_CONFIG=$(wc -c < splice-cep/panel/js/config.js)
SOURCE_MAIN=$(wc -c < splice-cep/panel/js/main.js)

echo ""
echo "Source file sizes:"
echo "  config.js: $SOURCE_CONFIG bytes"
echo "  main.js:   $SOURCE_MAIN bytes"

# Rebuild ZXP
echo ""
echo "Rebuilding ZXP..."
cd installer/scripts
./build-zxp.sh

# Verify ZXP
ZXP_CONFIG=$(unzip -p "$PROJECT_ROOT/installer/shared/splice-cep.zxp" \
    panel/js/config.js | wc -c)
ZXP_MAIN=$(unzip -p "$PROJECT_ROOT/installer/shared/splice-cep.zxp" \
    panel/js/main.js | wc -c)

echo ""
echo "ZXP file sizes:"
echo "  config.js: $ZXP_CONFIG bytes"
echo "  main.js:   $ZXP_MAIN bytes"

if [ "$SOURCE_CONFIG" -ne "$ZXP_CONFIG" ]; then
    echo ""
    echo "ERROR: ZXP config.js size mismatch!"
    echo "Source: $SOURCE_CONFIG, ZXP: $ZXP_CONFIG"
    exit 1
fi

if [ "$SOURCE_MAIN" -ne "$ZXP_MAIN" ]; then
    echo ""
    echo "ERROR: ZXP main.js size mismatch!"
    echo "Source: $SOURCE_MAIN, ZXP: $ZXP_MAIN"
    exit 1
fi

echo ""
echo "✅ ZXP verification passed"

# Rebuild PKG
echo ""
echo "Rebuilding PKG..."
cd "$PROJECT_ROOT/installer/macos"
./build-pkg.sh

# Get PKG info
PKG_FILE=$(ls -t "$PROJECT_ROOT/dist/SPLICE-Installer-"*.pkg | head -1)
PKG_SIZE=$(ls -lh "$PKG_FILE" | awk '{print $5}')
PKG_TIME=$(stat -f "%Sm" -t "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S" "$PKG_FILE")

echo ""
echo "==================================="
echo "✅ BUILD COMPLETE"
echo "==================================="
echo "PKG: $PKG_FILE"
echo "Size: $PKG_SIZE"
echo "Built: $PKG_TIME"
echo ""
echo "File verification:"
echo "  config.js: $SOURCE_CONFIG bytes ✅"
echo "  main.js:   $SOURCE_MAIN bytes ✅"
echo ""
echo "READY FOR DISTRIBUTION"

content.text:
Excellent! Now let me create a comprehensive summary document for you:

## Summary: Installer Directory Changes

Based on my analysis of the modified files in the installer directory, here's what work was in progress:

### **Version Update: 6.0.3 → 6.0.8**

The primary work involved bumping the SPLICE installer version from **6.0.3 to 6.0.8**. This is a significant version jump that required changes across multiple installer components.

---

### **Modified Components**

#### **1. Version Configuration**
- **File:** `installer/shared/version.json`
- **Change:** Version bumped from `6.0.3` to `6.0.8`
- **Impact:** This single source of truth is used by build scripts to stamp all installer artifacts

#### **2. macOS Installer Resources**
- **Files:**
  - `installer/macos/resources/welcome.html`
  - `installer/macos/resources/conclusion.html`
  - `installer/macos/build/resources/welcome.html` (copy)
  - `installer/macos/build/resources/conclusion.html` (copy)

- **Changes:**
  - Welcome screen: Updated heading from "Welcome to SPLICE v6.0.3" → "Welcome to SPLICE v6.0.8"
  - Conclusion screen: Updated success message from "SPLICE v6.0.3 has been successfully installed" → "SPLICE v6.0.8 has been successfully installed"
  - All UI text properly styled with dark theme (dark background, light text)

#### **3. Installer Configuration**
- **File:** `installer/macos/build/distribution.xml`
- **Change:** Version placeholders updated to use dynamic `{{VERSION}}` token
  - CEP package version: `6.0.3` → `{{VERSION}}`
  - UXP package version: `6.0.3` → `{{VERSION}}`
  - This allows the build script to inject the version from `version.json` during package creation

#### **4. Signing Script Enhancement**
- **File:** `installer/macos/sign-and-notarize.sh`
- **Change:** Minor formatting (added blank line at beginning)
- **Status:** Production-ready script for code signing and Apple notarization with:
  - Auto-detection of Developer ID Installer certificates
  - Support for both modern `notarytool` and legacy `altool`
  - Automatic stapling of notarization tickets
  - Comprehensive error handling and verification

#### **5. New Build Scripts (Untracked)**
- **`installer/scripts/build-zxp.sh`** (new, untracked)
  - Creates `.zxp` packages from CEP panel source
  - Supports optional signing with `ZXPSignCmd`
  - Supports JSXBin compilation for IP protection
  
- **`installer/scripts/verify-and-rebuild.sh`** (new, untracked)
  - Automated rebuild and verification pipeline
  - Validates file sizes match between source and packaged files
  - Builds ZXP and PKG in sequence
  - Reports final package size and timestamp

---

### **Build Artifacts Generated**

The following files were successfully built and are in the repository:

| Artifact | Size | Timestamp | Status |
|----------|------|-----------|--------|
| `dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.8.pkg` | 360.6 KB | 2026-01-12 15:37:35 | ✅ New |
| `installer/shared/splice-cep.zxp` | 173 KB | 2026-01-12 15:37 | ✅ Rebuilt |
| `installer/macos/build/splice-cep.pkg` | 143 KB | 2026-01-12 15:37 | ✅ Rebuilt |
| `installer/macos/build/splice-uxp.pkg` | 203 KB | 2026-01-12 15:37 | ✅ Rebuilt |

---

### **Work Status**

**Completed:**
- ✅ Version number updated across all resources
- ✅ HTML resources (welcome/conclusion screens) updated with v6.0.8
- ✅ Distribution configuration updated with dynamic version placeholders
- ✅ All component packages rebuilt (ZXP and PKG formats)
- ✅ Final installer PKG (6.0.8) created and ready for distribution
- ✅ Build and verification scripts created but not yet committed

**Not Started/Incomplete:**
- ❌ Two new helper scripts (`build-zxp.sh`, `verify-and-rebuild.sh`) are untracked and not in git
- ❌ Signing and notarization not yet applied (requires Developer ID certificate and Apple credentials)
- ❌ No code changes to the actual CEP panel or UXP plugin - only packaging/distribution updates

---

### **What This Represents**

This is a **release packaging phase** for version 6.0.8. The work focuses entirely on:
1. Updating version numbers across installer UI and configuration
2. Rebuilding the component packages (CEP extension and UXP plugin)
3. Creating the final distributable PKG installer
4. Setting up helper scripts for future builds

The actual application code changes that went into v6.0.8 are in the CEP and plugin source files (not in the installer directory itself).
